issues.description: Method name mismatch in the template repository: Stock.java calls ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...) but the provided ArrayHelpers.java in the template defines appendElement(...). This prevents the template from compiling and confuses students about which helper method name to use. The solution repository uses addElementToArray, so students following the template will hit a build error or be uncertain which name is canonical.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper method names consistent across the template and solution. Either rename the method in the template's ArrayHelpers.java from appendElement(...) to addElementToArray(...) or change the calls in Stock.java (and any other callers) to use appendElement(...). Preferably align the template with the solution by providing addElementToArray(...) in ArrayHelpers.java so Stock.java compiles as-is.

issues.description: Contradiction in the problem statement about where to initialize the stock attribute: the statement first instructs that the stock and orders should be "initialized to default values ... in the constructor of SealSaloon" but later explicitly requires the stock attribute to be static and final. A static final field cannot be initialized in an instance constructor (it must be initialized at declaration or in a static initializer). This is a structural contradiction that can confuse students about the correct placement and initialization of the shared stock.
issues.suggested_fix: Clarify the problem statement: specify that only the per-instance orders array should be initialized in the instance constructor, while the shared stock (declared static final) should be initialized at the point of declaration or in a static initializer. For example, state explicitly: "Initialize orders in the SealSaloon constructor; initialize the static final stock at its declaration (or in a static block)."

issues.description: The helper used to append an element to an array is named inconsistently between artifacts. The template's ArrayHelpers defines a method named appendElement(...), while the template's Stock class (and the solution repository) calls ArrayHelpers.addElementToArray(...). This inconsistent identifier for the same conceptual helper will cause compilation confusion for students (Stock calls a non-existent method) and forces them to resolve a naming mismatch rather than focus on the exercise logic.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the helper name consistent. Rename the template ArrayHelpers.appendElement(...) to addElementToArray(...) with the signature public static <T> T[] addElementToArray(T[] array, T element) so it matches the usage in Stock.java and the solution; alternatively update Stock.java to call appendElement(...). Preferred: rename the ArrayHelpers method to addElementToArray to align template and solution.
